decks.notes: The deck focuses on generating mana quickly using cards like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose, while also using cards like Desperate Ritual and Baral, Chief of Compliance to reduce the cost of spells. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces for a lethal Grapeshot or Past in Flames turn, using Gifts Ungiven to fetch the necessary cards. Protection is provided through cards like Remand and Apostle's Blessing, allowing the player to set up their win condition and disrupt their opponent's strategy.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the field and disrupting the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. The deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and Detention Sphere, while generating card advantage with Sphinx's Revelation and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also has access to powerful planeswalkers like Gideon Jura and Jace, Architect of Thought to further control the game. Additionally, the deck can disrupt opponent's mana base with cards like Spreading Seas and Tectonic Edge to gain the upper hand in the game.

This deck focuses on flooding the board with token creatures and using anthem effects to pump them up, creating a threatening board presence. It also includes disruption elements like discard spells and removal to control the opponent's game plan. The combination of token generation, anthem effects, disruption, and a few powerful planeswalkers make this deck a fast-paced and versatile Aggro strategy that aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck heavily focuses on using a combination of artifact creatures, equipment, and burn spells to quickly build a threatening board presence and deal damage to the opponent. Its strategy revolves around leveraging the synergy between cards like Cranial Plating, Steel Overseer, and Arcbound Ravager to pump up creatures and close out the game swiftly. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Master of Etherium and Hazoret the Fervent ensures that the deck has multiple ways to secure victory while maintaining a fast and aggressive playstyle.

The main concept of the deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Farseek, while also controlling the board with Anger of the Gods and Relic of Progenitus. The ultimate goal is to cast Scapeshift to sacrifice lands and search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Mountains in order to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck relies on Primeval Titan to search for key lands and Prismatic Omen to ensure all lands count as Mountains for Valakut's ability.

This deck focuses on using cheap artifacts and creatures to quickly swarm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. By utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager and Cranial Plating, along with support from Steel Overseer and Signal Pest, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast-paced aggressive strategy. With additional protection from Etched Champion and life gain from Vault Skirge, this deck is designed to put pressure on the opponent early on and maintain that pressure throughout the game. The mana base includes lands that provide flexibility and support the artifact-heavy theme of the deck.

The deck focuses on filling the graveyard quickly to enable powerful threats like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler to come out early and dominate the game. It also includes disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck is designed to be aggressive and proactive, controlling the game through a combination of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate, as well as countermagic like Stubborn Denial. The inclusion of cards like Snapcaster Mage and Kolaghan's Command provide additional value and flexibility in navigating different matchups.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt opponents' strategies while using life loss from Street Wraith and fetch lands to power up Death's Shadow and other delve creatures like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The deck aims to have a low life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow while also having access to removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate to control the board. This aggressive strategy aims to close out games quickly and efficiently.

The main focus of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's hand and board state while efficiently deploying powerful creatures with the Eldrazi tribe. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Tidehollow Sculler to disrupt the opponent's plans and remove key threats, the deck aims to clear a path for attackers like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer to close out the game quickly. With a mix of disruption, removal, and efficient creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through aggressive plays.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by manipulating the top card of opponents' libraries with Lantern of Insight and Ghoulcaller's Bell. It disrupts opponents' strategies with Pithing Needle, Surgical Extraction, and disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. Ensnaring Bridge and Leyline of Sanctity provide protection, while Mox Opal and Ancient Stirrings help with consistency. The deck aims to lock opponents out of the game by preventing them from drawing relevant cards, using controlling elements combined with a toolbox of disruption and protection cards.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Farseek to play Primeval Titan and Valakut, which will trigger Valakut's ability to deal damage to the opponent. This combo deck aims to quickly reach a critical mass of Mountains to deal massive amounts of damage to the opponent in a single turn using cards like Through the Breach and Chandra, Torch of Defiance. The deck also includes cards like Anger of the Gods and Relic of Progenitus to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and disruption spells. By utilizing cards like Tarmogoyf, Grim Flayer, and Siege Rhino, the deck can put pressure on the opponent's life total quickly. Additionally, the use of cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize allows the deck to disrupt the opponent's game plan and prevent them from stabilizing. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provides additional value and utility. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and aggressive while still having options for control and disruption.

This deck focuses on quickly emptying your own life total to make Death's Shadow a massive threat on the battlefield. By using cards like Street Wraith and Thoughtseize to lower your own life total, combined with efficient removal spells and card draw, you can quickly overwhelm your opponent with a huge Death's Shadow. Tasigur and Gurmag Angler provide additional threats, while Snapcaster Mage allows you to effectively reuse key spells. The deck's goal is to apply high pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately claiming victory through aggressive tactics.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. By disrupting the opponent's strategy with counters like Negate and removal like Path to Exile and Detention Sphere, while also slowing down their mana base with Spreading Seas and Tectonic Edge, this deck aims to draw the game out until it can establish a dominating board presence with threats like Celestial Colonnade and Gideon Jura. The inclusion of card draw spells like Serum Visions and Sphinx's Revelation allows the deck to maintain consistency and outvalue the opponent in the long run.

This deck focuses on early aggressive plays with Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, supported by powerful mana acceleration from Eldrazi Temple and the Urza lands. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer to control the opponent's game plan. Additionally, the deck has versatility with Karn Liberated and All Is Dust for removal and board control. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with powerful threats while disrupting their game plan with disruptive elements.

The main focus of this Merfolk aggro deck is to flood the board with low-cost creatures like Silvergill Adept and Cursecatcher, while using lord effects from cards like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost their power and toughness. The deck also includes disruption elements like Harbinger of the Tides and Dismember to control the opponent's board. Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls help with mana efficiency and spell resilience. The ultimate goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of Merfolk creatures and secure a quick victory.
